events: Power supply sends a signal to the motherboard to initialize the CPU
The BIOS/UEFI performs the Power-On Self-Test (POST) to check hardware health
The bootloader is located and loaded from the primary storage device into RAM
The operating system kernel initializes and assumes control of the system hardware
User-space services are launched and the login interface is displayed
question: Arrange the steps of a computer system boot sequence in the correct chronological order.
hint: Consider that hardware initialization and self-checks must be completed before any software or kernel components can be loaded into memory.
